intro: Calceolaria calycina, commonly known as the cupflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, pouch-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its foliage is usually broad and dark green, with the flowers displaying a range of colors from purple to white. Calceolaria calycina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a houseplant.
